title: Emanuel Swedenborg
summary: Emanuel Swedenborg (/ˈswiːdənbɔːrɡ/,[1] Swedish: [ˈsvêːdɛnˌbɔrj] (listen); born Emanuel Swedberg; 8 February [O.S. 29 January] 1688 – 29 March 1772)[2] was a Swedish pluralistic-Christian theologian, scientist, philosopher and mystic.[3] He became best known for his book on the afterlife, Heaven and Hell (1758).[4][5]
